CollectionCitations.Title: SORCE SOLSTICE MUV Level 3 Solar Spectral Irradiance Daily Means V016

EntryTitle: SORCE SOLSTICE MUV Level 3 Solar Spectral Irradiance Daily Means V016 (SOR3SOLMUVD) at GES DISC

RelatedUrls.Description: Access the dataset landing page from the GES DISC website.
Use the Earthdata Search to find and retrieve data sets across multiple data centers.

Abstract:
Version 016 is the current version of this data product, and supersedes all previous versions.

The SORCE SOLSTICE Mid-UV Solar Spectral Irradiance (SSI) data product SOR3SOLMUVD is constructed using measurements from the SOLSTICE MUV instrument, which are combined into merged daily solar spectra over the spectral range from 180 to 310 nm at a spectral resolution of 1 nm. Irradiances are reported at a mean solar distance of 1 AU and zero relative line-of-sight velocity with respect to the Sun. The SOLSTICE absolute uncertainty better than 5%.

All of the SOR3SOLMUVD data are arranged in a single file in a tabular ASCII text file which can be easily read into a spreadsheet application. The columns contain the date, Julian day, minimum wavelength, maximum wavelength, instrument mode, data version number, irradiance value, irradiance uncertainty, and data quality. The rows are arranged with data at each wavelength over the full SOLSTICE FUV wavelength range, repeating for each day for the length of the measurement period.
VersionDescription:
SOR3SOLMUVD Version 016 is the current version of this data product, and supersedes all previous versions. Please see the SORCE SIM Release Notes for detailed description and differences for this and previous versions.

Version 015 - Released 2015/11/02
Data availability: 2003/05/14 to 2018/11/25. The version 15 data was mostly an improvement in the level 3 degradation with smaller improvements to the underlying processing. There was also a new correction that helped to reduce the 1AU affects. Additionally, the data were released with a reduced delay.

Version 014 - Released May 2015
The Version 14 data was mostly a maintenance update for the processing code and data product. There were no significant calibration adjustments with this version. This version included data up to the current time and updates daily.

UseConstraints.Description: The Earth Observing System Data and Information System (EOSDIS) data use policy for NASA data can be accessed at https://earthdata.nasa.gov/earth-observation-data/data-use-policy.
